com.paypal.selion.platform.dataprovider

Class XmlDataProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paypal.selion.platform.dataprovider.XmlDataProvider

  • public final class XmlDataProvider
extends Object
    This class provides several methods to retrieve test data from XML files. Users can get data returned in an Object 2D array by loading the XML file. If the entire XML file is not needed then specific data entries can be retrieved by indexes.

        Generates a two dimensional array for TestNG DataProvider from the XML data.
        Parameters:
        xmlResource - A XmlFileSystemResource object containing the XML file location and representing type.
        Returns:
        A two dimensional object array.

      • getDataByFilter

        public static Iterator<Object[]> getDataByFilter(XmlFileSystemResource xmlResource,
                                 DataProviderFilter dataFilter)
        Generates an object array in iterator as TestNG DataProvider from the XML data filtered per dataFilter.
        Parameters:
        resource - A FileSystemResource that represents a data source.
        dataFilter - an implementation class of DataProviderFilter
        Returns:
        An iterator over a collection of Object Array to be used with TestNG DataProvider
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getDataByIndex

        public static Iterator<Object[]> getDataByIndex(XmlFileSystemResource xmlResource,
                                String filterIndexes)
        Generates an object array in iterator as TestNG DataProvider from the XML data filtered per given indexes string. This method may throw DataProviderException when an unexpected error occurs during data provision from XML file.
        Parameters:
        xmlResource - A XmlFileSystemResource that represents a data source.
        filterIndexes - - The indexes for which data is to be fetched as a conforming string pattern.
        Returns:
        An Iterator object to be used with TestNG DataProvider.

      • getDataByIndex

        public static Iterator<Object[]> getDataByIndex(XmlFileSystemResource xmlResource,
                                int[] indexes)
        Generates an object array in iterator as TestNG DataProvider from the XML data filtered per given indexes. This method may throw DataProviderException when an unexpected error occurs during data provision from XML file.
        Parameters:
        xmlResource - A XmlFileSystemResource that represents a data source.
        indexes - - The indexes for which data is to be fetched as a conforming string pattern.
        Returns:
        An Iterator object to be used with TestNG DataProvider.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getAllKeyValueData

        public static Object[][] getAllKeyValueData(XmlFileSystemResource xmlResource)
        Generates a two dimensional array for TestNG DataProvider from the XML data representing a map of name value collection. This method needs the referenced XmlFileSystemResource to be instantiated using its constructors with parameter Class<?> cls and set to KeyValueMap.class. The implementation in this method is tightly coupled with KeyValueMap and KeyValuePair. The hierarchy and name of the nodes are strictly as instructed. A name value pair should be represented as nodes 'key' and 'value' as child nodes contained in a parent node named 'item'. A sample data with proper tag names is shown here as an example :- 
         
     
         k1
         val1
     
     
         k2
         val2
     
     
         k3
         val3
        Parameters:
        xmlResource - A XmlFileSystemResource object containing the XML file location and representing type.
        Returns:
        A two dimensional object array.

      • getDataByKeys

        public static Object[][] getDataByKeys(XmlFileSystemResource xmlResource,
                       String[] keys)
        Generates a two dimensional array for TestNG DataProvider from the XML data representing a map of name value collection filtered by keys. A name value item should use the node name 'item' and a specific child structure since the implementation depends on KeyValuePair class. The structure of an item in collection is shown below where 'key' and 'value' are child nodes contained in a parent node named 'item' :- 
         
     
         k1
         val1
     
     
         k2
         val2
     
     
         k3
         val3
        Parameters:
        xmlResource - A XmlFileSystemResource object containing the XML file location and representing type.
        keys - The string keys to filter the data.
        Returns:
        A two dimensional object array.

      • readObjectByXpath

        public static <T> T readObjectByXpath(Object object,
                      Class<T> cls,
                      String xpath)
        Traverses the object graph by following an XPath expression and returns the desired type from object matched at the XPath. Supports single object retrieval. Also see DataProviderHelper#readListByXpath(Object, Class, String). Note: Need object and cls to have getter and setter properties defined to allow object graph traversal.
        Parameters:
        object - An object of any type
        cls - Type of the property being evaluated at the given xpath.
        xpath - The XPath expression equivalent to the object graph.
        Returns:
        An object of desired type.

      • readListByXpath

        public static <T> List<T> readListByXpath(Object object,
                          Class<T> cls,
                          String xpath)
        Traverses the object graph by following an XPath expression and returns a list of desired type from object matched at the XPath. Only supports multiple object retrieval as a list. See // * DataProviderHelper#readObjectByXpath(Object, Class, String) for single object retrieval. Note: Need object and cls to have getter and setter properties defined to allow object graph traversal.
        Parameters:
        object - An object of any type
        cls - Type of the property being evaluated at the given xpath.
        xpath - The XPath expression equivalent to the object graph.
        Returns:
        An object of desired type.
